Al-Hilal’s offer: Kylian Mbappe could earn ₹1.2 lakhs in 1 minute










Al-Hilal’s offer: Kylian Mbappe could earn ₹1.2 lakhs in 1 minute

Al-Hilal has made an offer for Kylian Mbappe which might be too good to refuse. The offer could make him earn ₹ 1.2 lakhs in a minute.


 
Football


By Pragun Mehrotra 
On Jul 26, 2023





 




Saudi Clubs over the last few months have been splashing money like never seen before. Al-Hilal who finished third in Saudi Pro League in the 2022/23 season has made a highly lucrative to French sensation Kylian Mbappe. The Mbappe transfer saga from Paris Saint-Germain has been going on for some time now. It was always expected that PSG’s star player would make a move to the European giants, Real Madrid. Al-Hilal’s offer could change that move which can see Mbappe earning more than 1.2 lakh Rs in just a minute.

Al-Hilal’s Offer

Al-Hilal has offered 259 million pounds to PSG for acquiring the services of the 24-year-old. This transfer fee is already a world record-breaking amount. On top of the transfer fee, Al-Hilal has offered a whopping salary of 604 million pounds. This salary would mean that Mbappe could earn £50.39m a month. £11.49m a week, £1.64m a day. £69,920m an hour. £1,150 a minute, £19 per second. Just to put things in perspective, if we convert his salary to Indian Rupees (INR) (₹), Mbappe would earn ₹ 532.775 crores per month, ₹ 121.484 crores per week, ₹ 17.339 crores per day, ₹ 1.21 lakhs per minute and ₹ 2000 per second.


Advertisement


 Mbappe’s salary of 604 million pounds will surpass the salaries of national teammate Karim Benzema and his idol, Cristiano Ronaldo. Benzema at Al-Ittihad earns 172.77 million pounds per year while Ronaldo at Al Nassr earns 177.1 million pounds per year. Saudi is already a hot place but the offers they are making to footballers might just make it the hottest place in the football world.

Internet erupts

When the news of his salary broke out internet erupted. People and sportspersons from all over the world reacted to the news on Twitter (X). 

Giannis Antetokounmpo who plays for Milwaukee Bucks in NBA reacted to the news.


Al Hilal you can take me. I look like Kylian Mbappe  pic.twitter.com/VH0syez3VX

— Giannis Antetokounmpo (@Giannis_An34) July 24, 2023



Antetokounmpo was not the only NBA star who reacted to the salary. One of the greatest if not the greatest player of all time, LeBron James too reacted to the news.


Me headed to Saudi when they call @RichPaul4 & @mavcarter for that 1 year deal! ✌‍♂️ pic.twitter.com/IX0VSMZYNb

— LeBron James (@KingJames) July 25, 2023



LeBron signed a new contract with the Los Angeles Lakers which made him the highest-paid player in terms of salary in NBA history. The new contract means that James earns 532 million dollars a year.



Related Posts










 
Bremen Secures 1-0 Victory Over Bayern, Dealing a Blow to... 

 









 
Kalinga Super Cup: Chennaiyin FC go down 0-1 against Mumbai... 

 









 
Man United appoint new CEO Omar Berrada from rivals Man City 

 







 Portland Trail Blazers player, Damian Lillard and Golden State Warriors forward Draymond Green also took to Twitter and gave out their reactions. 


1 year 776mm? Wtf lol ...

— Damian Lillard (@Dame_Lillard) July 24, 2023




They got basketball leagues too right?  I don’t the ink on my contract has dried up yet 

— Draymond Green (@Money23Green) July 25, 2023



The sprint world record holder, Usain Bolt too gave out his reaction.


I’m ready to unretire for this one year salary $776M 

— Usain St. Leo Bolt (@usainbolt) July 25, 2023



Notably, Usain Bolt too played football. The 100 metres and 200 metres world record holder played for Central Coast Mariners in the Australian League.

Mbappe’s family accepts the offer?

There have been reports going on the internet that Kylian Mbappe’s family is ready to accept the offer. The player on the other hand is yet to decide. 

Mbappe despite the lucrative offer wants to stay at the French club for another year and leave for Real Madrid next season. His move to the Saudi club even if only for a year could be a big positive move for football in Saudi Arabia.

Also Read: How will Arsenal line up after Rice and Havertz signing?

<div class="container layout-2-col layout-2-col-1 layout-right-sidebar layout-bc-before post-template-1">
<div class="row main-section">
<div class="col-sm-8 content-column">
<div class="single-container">
<article id="post-90549" class="post-90549 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail  category-football tag-al-hilal tag-benzema tag-central-coast-mariners tag-cristiano-ronaldo tag-damian-lillard tag-draymond-green tag-giannis-antetokounmpo tag-golden-state-warriors tag-karim-benzema tag-kylian-mbappe tag-kylian-mbappes-salary tag-kylian-mbappes-salary-in-inr tag-kylian-mbappes-salary-in-rupees tag-lebron tag-lebron-james tag-los-angeles-lakers tag-mbappe tag-mbappe-salary tag-mbappe-salary-in-rupees tag-nba tag-real-madrid tag-ronaldo tag-saudi-arabia tag-usain-bolt tag-world-record single-post-content has-thumbnail">
<div class="post-header post-tp-1-header">
<h1 class="single-post-title">
<span class="post-title" itemprop="headline">Al-Hilal’s offer: Kylian Mbappe could earn ₹1.2 lakhs in 1 minute</span></h1>

<div class="single-post-excerpt post-excerpt-at"><p>Al-Hilal has made an offer for Kylian Mbappe which might be too good to refuse. The offer could make him earn ₹ 1.2 lakhs in a minute.</p>

</div>
 <div class="post-meta-wrap clearfix">
<div class="term-badges "><span class="term-badge term-37"><a href="https://sportsdigest.in/category/football/" target="_blank">Football</a></span></div>
<div class="post-meta single-post-meta">
<a href="https://sportsdigest.in/author/pragun/" title="Browse Author Articles" class="post-author-a post-author-avatar" target="_blank">
<img alt data-src="https://sportsdigest.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/Pragun-Mehrotra-150x150.jpg" class="avatar avatar-26 photo avatar-default" height="26" width="26"><span class="post-author-name">By <b>Pragun Mehrotra</b></span> </a>
<span class="time"><time class="post-published updated" datetime="2023-07-26T12:53:44+05:30">On <b>Jul 26, 2023</b></time></span>
</div>

</div>

<div class="single-featured">
<img width="1200" height="675" alt="Al-Hilal’s offer: Kylian Mbappe could earn ₹1.2 lakhs in 1 minute" data-src="https://sportsdigest.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Kylian-Mbappe-Al-Hilal.jpg"> </div>

</div>

<div class="entry-content clearfix single-post-content">
<p><span style="font-weight: 400">Saudi Clubs over the last few months have been splashing money like never seen before. Al-Hilal who finished third in Saudi Pro League in the 2022/23 season has made a highly lucrative to French sensation </span><a href="https://sportsdigest.in/news/kylian-mbappe/" target="_blank"><b>Kylian Mbappe</b></a><span style="font-weight: 400">. The Mbappe transfer saga from Paris Saint-Germain has been going on for some time now. It was always expected that </span><a href="https://sportsdigest.in/news/psg/" target="_blank"><b>PSG</b></a><span style="font-weight: 400">’s star player would make a move to the European giants, Real Madrid. Al-Hilal’s offer could change that move which can see Mbappe earning more than 1.2 lakh Rs in just a minute.</span></p>

<h3><b>Al-Hilal’s Offer</b></h3>

<p><span style="font-weight: 400">Al-Hilal has offered 259 million pounds to PSG for acquiring the services of the 24-year-old. This transfer fee is already a world record-breaking amount. On top of the transfer fee, Al-Hilal has offered a whopping salary of 604 million pounds. This salary would mean that </span><a href="https://sportsdigest.in/news/mbappe/" target="_blank"><b>Mbappe</b></a><span style="font-weight: 400"> could earn £50.39m a month. £11.49m a week, £1.64m a day. £69,920m an hour. £1,150 a minute, £19 per second. Just to put things in perspective, if we convert his salary to Indian Rupees (INR) (₹), Mbappe would earn ₹ 532.775 crores per month, ₹ 121.484 crores per week, ₹ 17.339 crores per day, ₹ 1.21 lakhs per minute and ₹ 2000 per second.</span></p>

<div class="xif xif-post-inline xif-align-center xif-align-center xif-column-1 no-bg-box-model"><div id="xif-95560-1664021680" class="xif-container xif-type-code " itemscope itemtype="https://schema.org/WPAdBlock" data-adid="95560" data-type="code"><div id="xif-95560-1664021680-place"></div>
<p class="xif-caption xif-caption-below">Advertisement</p>
</div>
</div>
 <p><span style="font-weight: 400">Mbappe’s salary of 604 million pounds will surpass the salaries of national teammate Karim Benzema and his idol, Cristiano Ronaldo. Benzema at Al-Ittihad earns 172.77 million pounds per year while Ronaldo at Al Nassr earns 177.1 million pounds per year. Saudi is already a hot place but the offers they are making to footballers might just make it the hottest place in the football world.</span></p>

<h3><b>Internet erupts</b></h3>

<p><span style="font-weight: 400">When the news of his salary broke out internet erupted. People and sportspersons from all over the world reacted to the news on Twitter (X). </span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: 400">Giannis Antetokounmpo who plays for Milwaukee Bucks in NBA reacted to the news.</span></p>

<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-width="550" data-dnt="true">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">Al Hilal you can take me. I look like Kylian Mbappe  <a href="https://t.co/VH0syez3VX" target="_blank">pic.twitter.com/VH0syez3VX</a></p>

<p>— Giannis Antetokounmpo (@Giannis_An34) <a href="https://twitter.com/Giannis_An34/status/1683549442287255552?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" target="_blank">July 24, 2023</a></p>
</blockquote>
<p></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: 400">Antetokounmpo was not the only NBA star who reacted to the salary. One of the greatest if not the greatest player of all time, LeBron James too reacted to the news.</span></p>

<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-width="550" data-dnt="true">
<p lang="en" dir="ltr">Me headed to Saudi when they call <a href="https://twitter.com/RichPaul4?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" target="_blank">@RichPaul4</a> & <a href="https://twitter.com/mavcarter?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" target="_blank">@mavcarter</a> for that 1 year deal! ✌‍♂️ <a href="https://t.co/IX0VSMZYNb" target="_blank">pic.twitter.com/IX0VSMZYNb</a></p>

<p>— LeBron James (@KingJames) <a href="https://twitter.com/KingJames/status/1683634303203422209?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" target="_blank">July 25, 2023</a></p>
</blockquote>
<p></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: 400">LeBron signed a new contract with the Los Angeles Lakers which made him the highest-paid player in terms of salary in NBA history. The new contract means that James earns 532 million dollars a year.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: 400">Notably, Usain Bolt too played football. The 100 metres and 200 metres world record holder played for Central Coast Mariners in the Australian League.</span></p>

<h3><b>Mbappe’s family accepts the offer?</b></h3>

<p><span style="font-weight: 400">There have been reports going on the internet that Kylian Mbappe’s family is ready to accept the offer. The player on the other hand is yet to decide. </span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: 400">Mbappe despite the lucrative offer wants to stay at the French club for another year and leave for Real Madrid next season. His move to the Saudi club even if only for a year could be a big positive move for football in Saudi Arabia.</span><span id="more-90549"></span></p>
